N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.78 - Omnibuses

State Regulations
(a) Under no
circumstances shall a trailer be attached to an omnibus being used in the
transportation of passengers. (b) In
all omnibuses at least one portable fire extinguisher of the size and type
approved by a recognized laboratory under classification 4-BC, shall be
provided, properly filled and serviceable and mounted so as to be readily
accessible for use. Every omnibus, except sedan type omnibuses, shall either
display or have readily accessible for display at least one conspicuously
lettered sign reading "SMOKING PROHIBITED", and shall display with oral
instruction by the driver whenever vehicle is operated on other than air
terminal highways or public vehicular parking lots. Notes
